definition: Oedipus, hero of tragedy by Athenian dramatist Sophocles
Russia/Russian/abbr. for 俄羅斯|俄罗斯[E2 luo2 si1]/Taiwan pr. [E4]
surname Di/generic name for northern ethnic minorities during the Qin and Han Dynasties (221 BC-220 AD)
Slovakia/Slovak/abbr. for 斯洛伐克[Si1 luo4 fa2 ke4]

sentences.english: Write in Oedipus tracking down before the king the murderer killed a center events.
sentences.chinese: 中写俄狄浦斯追查杀害前王凶手这一中心事件。

sentences.english: Chapter one analyzes the development of the disguised ancient Oedipus theme in this modern play.
sentences.chinese: 第一章简述俄狄浦斯这一古老主题的现代演绎。

sentences.english: Oedipus the king is one of the great tragedies written by Sophocles.
sentences.chinese: 《俄狄浦斯王》是索福克勒斯最伟大的悲剧之一。

sentences.english: Thus, CEdipus at the outset obeys fate without knowing it.
sentences.chinese: 因此，俄狄浦斯在一开始便不知不觉地顺从了命运。

sentences.english: It is a perfect instance of the Oedipus complex.
sentences.chinese: 这是俄狄浦斯复杂性的一个完美例证。

sentences.english: When he came on I was a bit surprised, is this Oedipus ?
sentences.chinese: 当他出现的时候，我有一点惊讶，这是俄狄浦斯吗？
俄狄浦斯情结是这样的。

sentences.english: Once upon a time ago, in Thebes i am king, Oedipus the king.
sentences.chinese: 很久以前，我俄狄浦斯是忒拜的国王。

sentences.english: Oedipus met Sphinx on a cliff.
sentences.chinese: 俄狄浦斯上遇到了狮身人面像悬崖。

definition: Oedipus, legendary king of Thebes who killed his father and married his mother
Euripides (c. 480-406 BC), Greek tragedian, author of Medea, Trojan Women etc
Sophocles (496-406 BC), Greek tragedian, author of Oedipus the King
King Lear, 1605 tragedy by William Shakespeare 莎士比亞|莎士比亚
Aeschylus (c. 524 BC -c. 455 BC), Greek tragedian, author of The Persians, Seven against Thebes etc
Macbeth (name)/Macbeth, 1606 tragedy by William Shakespeare 莎士比亞|莎士比亚
Floyd (name)/Freud (name)/Dr Sigmund Freud (1856-1939), the founder of psychoanalysis
Fyodor Mikhailovich Dostoevsky (1821-1881), great Russian novelist, author of Crime and Punishment 罪與罰|罪与罚[Zui4 yu3 Fa2]
pinyin: Tuo2 si1 tuo3 ye1 fu1 si1 ji1
